author: Staff Reporter
text:
Around 400 members from various associations of Tamil Nadu Cooperative Housing Society staged a picketing protest near the Collectorate highlighting various demands including the immediate release of salaries pending for more than four years.

The employees, under the banner of the Tamil Nadu Cooperative Housing Society Employees’ Associations’ Coordination Committee, staged the protest simultaneously in Madurai and Salem on Monday to raise their long pending demands.

K. Murugesan, General Secretary of the Coordination Committee, said that thousands of employees associated with 816 cooperative housing societies, were not paid salaries for the last four years. “We request the government to immediately release the pending salary of Rs. 46 crore,” he said.

He said that the cooperative housing societies, which lent loans amounting to Rs. 4,753 crore to families with middle and poor income over the years, have lost their revenue as they were not in a position to sanction fresh loans for the past 10 years.

The associations demanded that as no new loans were being sanctioned, the excess employees in the cooperative housing societies be transferred to cooperative banks in the existing vacancies.

They also demanded that the huge losses incurred by the cooperative housing societies owing to loan waivers announced since 2003 be compensated fully by the Tamil Nadu government.

“The government should also consider implementing the union government’s “Housing for All” scheme through the cooperative societies so that the societies can sustain themselves,” Mr. Murugesan said.

The protesters were detained and later released by the Madurai City police.
title: Staff of cooperative housing societies stage protest
